H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2530.def: = process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H4940.def: = a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4185.def: = process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H5091.def: = action by which humans sing a mournful song ► to give expression to their grief

H5092.def: = action by which humans sing a mournful song ► to give expression to their grief

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H4171.def: = process by which objects take on different characteristics

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H4185.def: = process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H7728.def: = a person or group that has turned away from someone they had pledged to serve

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H4611.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H865.def: = reference to the day before the current day; sometimes used to refer to a point of time in the recent past as if it happened the day before

H4136.def: = relational linking an event to a location right in front of another location

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H145.def: = state of being regarded with honor and respect

H8008.def: = a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose-fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H1644.def: = process by which large bodies of water move back and forth as a result of natural forces

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1926.def: = state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4496.def: literally: rest; hence: = a state of mind in which humans find relief after a time of distress

H2930.def: = process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

H4834.def: = process by which an event causes grief and suffering to those experiencing it

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H1223.def: = area enclosed by a stone wall or hedge made of branches and thorns, with a narrow opening which can be closed with brush or by the shepherd’s body; ► used for keeping sheep at night to protect them from thieves or wild animals

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H1949.def: = process by which an area trembles ◄ as a result of the noise of a multitude of people

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
